snippet: Government prosecutors failed to tell a defendant that evidence derived from warrantless wiretapping would be used at trial.
abstract: Justice Department defends it conduct to federal judge in Oregon when prosecutors failed to tell a defendant that he faced evidence derived from warrantless wiretapping before his 2013 trial on terrorism-related charges; also denies it misled the Supreme Court in 2012 during a high-profile case challenging law that authorizes National Security Agency’s warrantless wiretapping program.
lead_paragraph: Government prosecutors failed to tell a defendant that evidence derived from warrantless wiretapping would be used at trial.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Defends Its Conduct on Evidence
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Defends Its Conduct on Evidence

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
